arm_group.description: One unit of blood stored for less than 14 days
One unit of blood stored under standard conditions

brief_summary.textblock:
Transfusion of stored blood has been associated with increased pulmonary vascular resistance
      in lambs. The investigators hypothesize that transfusion of one unit of red blood cells
      stored under standard conditions in intensive care patients will increase pulmonary arterial
      pressure and pulmonary vascular resistance to a greater extent than will one unit of fresh
      red blood cells.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hemodynamic Effects of Stored Blood Transfusion in Intensive Care Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. The patient has a pulmonary artery catheter in place

          2. Transfusion of 1 unit of packed red blood cells indicated for standard intensive care
             therapy

          3. The patient has an arterial catheter

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Age < 18 years

          2. Clinical prediction that the patient will not survive at least 48 hours

          3. Acute bleeding: > 2 units of packed red blood cells/hour

          4. Vasopressor use: noradrenalin > 0.2 μg/kg/min or any use of adrenalin within 6 hours
             of inclusion into the study

          5. Therapy with inhaled NO, inhaled prostacyclin, or phosphodiesterase-5-inhibitors

          6. Sepsis

intervention.description: One unit of red blood cells will be transfused over the course of 20 minutes

facility.name: General Hospital of the Medical University of Vienna

clinical_study.official_title: Hemodynamic Effects of Stored Blood Transfusion in Intensive Care Patients

authority: Austria: Agency for Health and Food Safety
